page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT (1980s), DUNDEE
page.content: DUNDEE, Scotland's second industrial city, has{26%}of its workforce in{ {manufacturing}and{66%}in the{service { sector.}It had a long manufacturing history in shipbuilding, marine engineering, flax and jute. As these { {traditional industries declined,}the area faced severe economic problems. These industries did contribute towards a skills base upon which are founded some of the{new technology {industries}such as electronics, instrument and electrical engineering.In recent years there has been a marked growth in the{service {sector}of tourism, health, transport, hotel and catering, retail & distribution trades. The Region and District Councils and the SDA have combined to encourage through{The Blackness Project}& other areas with{Enterprise Zone Status.}
